resources.string: Janusz Korczak (1878–1942) Polish-Jewish doctor, writer, educator, co-founder and director of Orphans\' Home for Children. He wrote books for children and pedagogical works. He was the author of radio talks, admired by entire families, where he preached the rights of the child. He taught how to love children, how to see his needs, possibilities and spoke against corporal punishment. During the II World War, in 1942 German Nazis deported Korczak, his assistants and 200 children from the Orphans\' Home to extermination camp where they were all murdered.\n
